name: Sarah's Gluten- and Dairy-Free Cornbread
author: Brittany Bear
summary: A friend showed me this recipe, which her father used when she was forced to eat gluten free. This is one of the easiest and best-tasting gluten-free recipes around. If you forget to mention it to those that are not gluten free-they will never know! Success! I have also used this for cornbread stuffing around the holidays, and it is always a favorite!
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Whisk almond milk, eggs, coconut oil, and honey together in a small bowl
Stir cornmeal, cornstarch, sweet rice flour, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl
Add almond milk mixture and whisk until combined
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes
